Mark your calendars for April 8, 2024: A total solar eclipse will darken the skies of North America as the Moon blocks the light of the Sun for a few minutes.

We're funding five experiments to study the Sun, Earth, and their interactions: https://go.nasa.gov/42T5U9L

Training begins for the 
@NASAArtemis
 II astronauts!

While some of us are enjoying the start of summer vacation, they just began training for their mission to the Moon and back.

Here's the trajectory map they covered in class this week: https://go.nasa.gov/44dztUs
You know about earthquakes, but what about moonquakes and marsquakes? We asked a NASA scientist about what otherworldly quakes can tell us: https://go.nasa.gov/3N68hP1

Oh, those summer nights! It's the #SummerSolstice, the longest day in the Northern Hemisphere—and the shortest in the Southern Hemisphere where winter starts.

Glance up tonight for a planetary cameo, with Mars and Venus just beside the Moon: https://go.nasa.gov/3CDqMaj

LIVE: Watch the ribbon-cutting for our new Earth Information Center at NASA Headquarters in Washington. The new tool will provide data to the public and decision makers to help adapt and respond to our changing planet: https://go.nasa.gov/eic
The Sun emitted a strong solar flare on June 20, 2023, peaking at 1:09 ET. NASA’s Solar Dynamics Observatory captured an image of the event, which was classified as X1.0. https://go.nasa.gov/3qSaNT7

Another exciting week at NASA in the books!

The #CRS28 mission delivered cargo to the @Space_Station and @NASA_Astronauts Steve Bowen and @Astro_Woody performed a spacewalk to upgrade the space station’s power supply.

Get all the details: http://nasa.gov/subscribe

Smoke from wildfires in Quebec moved across eastern portions of Canada and the U.S. this week. This @NASAEarth computer model used satellite, aircraft, and ground-based data to track the black carbon particles (soot) and hazardous air. https://go.nasa.gov/3J4yaiu

Today our #NASAInterns completed their first week at @NASA. Already these #ArtemisGeneration interns are putting their talent and creativity to work for the betterment of all. 

Welcome to the team!
.@NASA_Astronauts Stephen Bowen and @Astro_Woody successfully installed and deployed the space station's fifth roll-out solar array during a six-hour and three-minute spacewalk today.
Upgrade in progress: a new solar array unrolls on the @Space_Station. It will produce more than 20 kilowatts of electricity to augment the station's power supply and support more @ISS_Research.

Time for work! @NASA_Astronauts Steve Bowen and @Astro_Woody have switched their suits to battery power and exited the Quest airlock. Now, they’ll install a roll-out solar array on the @Space_Station.
LIVE: Spacewalk with us. Watch as @NASA_Astronauts Steve Bowen and @Astro_Woody install a new roll-out solar array on the @Space_Station, scheduled to start at 9:15am ET.
